page.title: 18Memories of Newburn Village
page.content: and of course the world famous Spencers Steel Works. Most of the traffic was horse drawn, we had a large horse trough and a trap.There was an off license which supplied beer by the bucketfull for the steel workers.When the steel works were working Newburn was a thriving shopping centre.Money was short,people were much more neighbourly and friendly. Bill Stobbarts pig farm used to be in the field that is fenced off,next to Moor Ct.Next to it,on the edge of the Tyne ,is an old black wooden hut,standing half in the water,and half on the land.This was the Water Bailif's home.Part of his job was to row people over the Tyne to Ryton Willows for a penny.Boats from S.Shields used to come there in summer for Hoppings etc.(Mr J.Lackenby)
